reviewText:
It could have been so great.  The way in which you explore and discover the story was set up and executed so well.  ...but then you finish the game and realize there wasn't much of a story.  I was angry.  It went from A...to B.  The end.  It tantalizingly dangles a number of what seem like plot points, setting up an atmosphere of concern and cautious curiosity as you try to understand where the family has gone. Then it betrays you and you are left with the most clich√© ‚Äòstory‚Äô and ending after a mere 2 hours of wandering around.  All that other stuff you were learning about? Nah, don‚Äôt worry about it.  This is nothing but an angsty teenage emotions crapfest with a story that you SHOULD have seen through within a half hour, but because the game plays you for a fool with its convincing lies about what it really is, you don‚Äôt see it coming.

‚ÄúOh, you‚Äôre just mad that you wanted the game to be something it never promised to be.‚Äù  No, this game insinuated the entire time all sorts of things, and in the end delivers you a silver platter of crap.

Don‚Äôt waste your money unless you are a teenage girl.
voteText: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful

reviewText: TLDR: I wish I had bought a better game.\n\nIt had an interesting mystery, but the creepiness wore off about 30 minutes into the game, and it just became a bit of a chore. reviewText: Well, I wish I could say I liked this game.  However, the asking price of 20 dollars seems steep for a game that is only about an 1 hour long, and even shorter if you ignore the entries and such (I got it on sale at 10, but I still feel the same).  While I thought the story was okay, it does not make the gap from gameplay to price.  While the narrative has a somewhat interesting approach, I feel like you could do most of this on gmod with slightly less quality.  I think the worst part is that there is clearly some well thought intentions in the game, but it doesn't work since the game is so short.  Gameplay wise, there is nothing other than exploration with some easy puzzles.  Also, I have had games with fast paced action with less strain on my system, which is strange, because there is very little going on in this game.\n\nidk, was ok 10/10

reviewText:
Let me start by saying this isn't really a game, so it's not going to be for everyone.

I have always been a big fan of games that focus more on the story and artistic expression so orignally this game really appealed to me. However, after playing it I just didnt feel as involved with the story and the characters as I would have liked. It was a bit boring to be honest.

It took me about 2 hours to complete and currently it is priced at $20, so to me it's not really worth it to buy.

Im glad I completed it but I wouldnt recommend buying it unless it's on sale.
voteText: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful

reviewText: I'm writing this review while being torn as whether to recommend this game or not to anyone. I'll first say that this purchase was largely influenced by praise from IGN and a 50% sale. As for Gone Home itself, it's not really a game, so much as an interactive story. While the story is really good (a work of art, really), a single playthrough took me less than 3 hours to finish, and I took my time. Did I enjoy playing it? Yes. But this type of game has by nature no replayability. Do I think the price tag was worth it? No. For these reasons, I can't recommend it. But if you do for some reason buy it, you will want to get it on sale.
voteText: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful

reviewText: I'm glad I bought this game when it was on sale on the Humble Store for $5. Wait, no I wish I would have saved the $5 for a good cheeseburger. This was not at all what I was expecting, and I felt it was misleading. First the good points: The voice acting was great, and the graphics and atmosphere were awesome. Now the bad points: The atmosphere that is created gives a kind of horror" theme that is misleading and non-existent. They hint at a possibly scary story with the "ghost" of the guy who lived in the house before. That turns out to be a bust too. My main problem with this game was its hidden agenda. There's no mention of the LGBT message that fuels this game until a while into playing it. I feel that the high ratings it is getting are simply because it touches on this politically charged issue and nobody wants to say it stinks. I have nothing against gay people
date: nothing against a "game" that addresses the topic
recommended: I just felt misled into buying something that I was not looking for. For those looking to buy this game: Be warned that it is about a homosexual girl and that it is way overpriced. If you really want it
hoursPlayed: wait for a sale."

reviewText: Amazingly well-paced, considering it's basically an interactive novel. Voice acting and music are top-notch. You are experiencing a primary story with multiple supporting narratives throughout. One thing I really loved is that (virtually) everything in the game is still accessable at later points, so you can backtrack and replay" or re-experience parts of the narrative. This is like flipping back to a favourite or poignant part of a novel. This is much more a literary experience than a "game" in that sense... though I'm sure all the reviews say that.\n\nTime to completion is 2 hours. There's probably some replayability - I think I missed a few things in Oscar's thread
date: for example - but I'm overall satisfied with the experience and probably won't play again for a long time. That said
recommended: the sale price is definitely worth it
hoursPlayed: and had I known how solid and enjoyable experience it was I would gladly have paid full price (equivalent to a movie admission
voteText: or cost of a good novel
helpfulPercent: which is what this experience most closely resembles)."
votesTotal: true

reviewText: Pack your bags, we're going on a feels trip.  This is a beautiful game, and not to be missed.  It has echoes of Dear Esther, but with a greater level of interactivity, and a more defined story.  You'll either fall in love with it, or pass it off due to it's brevity (2 hours) and minimal gamey" elements.  I won't spoil anything about the story
date: but you play as a young woman who comes back from a year overseas to find her home empty.  You explore the house and try to piece together what happened.  This is not a horror game.  The voice acting is some of the best I've ever experienced
recommended: and the shortness of the game works in it's favour.  The price tag might seem a little high
hoursPlayed: but trust me it's worth it.\n\nBefore you play
voteText: two important tips:\n1) Take your time to explore thoroughly
helpfulPercent: and pick up everything interesting in case there's a story behind it\n2) Set aside some time to play
votesHelpful: and play it all in one sitting"
